content:
const fill = (array, x, i, j) => array.fill(x, i, j);
export default fill;

name: src/array/core/histogram.js
histogram
description: O(N) time where N = j - i;

name: src/array/core/load.js
src/array/core/loadLengths.js
src/array/core/permute.js
src/array/core/permuteInPlace.js
src/array/core/rank.js

params.name: ch
params.description: The cumulative histogram of the input.

params.name: i
params.description: Inclusive left boundary of the array.

params.name: j
params.description: Non-inclusive right boundary of the array.

name: src/array/core/reset.js
src/array/core/sortArbitraryTuples.js
src/array/core/sortFixedLengthTuples.js
sortFixedLengthTuples
description:
O(kM + kN) time where k is the number of digits per tuple, M is the radix, and
N = j - i is the number of tuples. The product kN corresponds to the input size.

name: src/array/core/sortTuplesByLength.js
sortTuplesByLength
description:
O(M + N) time where M is the maximum length of a tuple, and
N is the number of tuples.

name: src/array/core/stable.js
stable
description:
O(kM + kN) time where k is the number of arrays, M is the radix, and
N is the length of each array. The product kN corresponds to the input size.

name: src/array/core/zeros.js
content:
const zeros = (n) => new Int32Array(n);
export default zeros;

:oden: [@aureooms/js-radix-sort](https://aureooms.github.io/js-radix-sort)
==

Radix sorting algorithms for JavaScript.
Parent is [@aureooms/js-sort](https://github.com/aureooms/js-sort).

content: # Overview

name: ./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs),
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com),
or [jspm](https://jspm.org/docs).


### yarn
```terminal
yarn add @aureooms/js-radix-sort
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @aureooms/js-radix-sort --save
```

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@aureooms/js-radix-sort
```
